d2OeQQg9MjwjFjAwTObKiQ.text: The name speaks for itself, best satay 7 and 8 are the ones you want to visit. It's outdoor seating, just ignore the people bombarding you with seafood menu. Just get the satays. Get yourself a Tiger beer to go along with your satay.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Shrimp, chicken, beef and a Tiger beer.

4hTcywFYuQqj5_869eI2wA.text: The name says it all! This place serves the best chicken satay I've ever had! We tried neighboring stalls and they were good but pales in comparison to this place! Super juicy and multitude of flavors that I just can't describe! Worth every last penny I have!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Shrimp chicken and lamb satay oh my lawdddd good!
Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken and lamb satay with peanut sauce I could drink it was so good!

sor5bGY0ItgRze9KT0pYJA.text: For my first night in Singapore, I thought I'd head over to well-known La Pa Sat for late dinner. I decided to treat myself to some satay and there was no better place to go to than the Best in stall 7 & 8.I got half the smallest set for $13 with 5 sticks chicken, 5 sticks beef and 3 sticks prawn. Ot was all delicious and I love the flavoir of the dipping sauce. I got a large iced kopi from the nearby Kopitiam stall and it was a nice, refreshing way to end the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Half the basic order at $13
Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Only from The Best, stall 7&8

akWGnxzXkrBAGXhndCkK8w.text: The first bite of food we tasted in singapore and we were so pleased. The satay and the amazing chutney with a cold beer. very friendly staff and the owner is out there mingling with the customers as well making sure everything goes right. if you ask her for something you can enjoy while she yells at one of her workers to bring it to you.. awesome. We LOVED this place. Thank you for being a great welcome in our first few hours in singapore. Also grab a stretched tea!

vBaVvDL2wgK2xLJM916KkQ.text: I declare Saturday nights in Singapore Satay Night - visit stalls 7 & 8 to get your fix!Lau Pa Sat Market is an absolute gem and Best Satay located on the street straight outside is no exception. Fresh, tasty satays available in chicken, beef & prawn - so good! The addition of diced cucumber is a refreshing way to end the perfect satay feast. I'd highly recommend you bringing some wipes or napkins as your fingers will get sticky with satay goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore

DB_MjF1F-_NAJTr8-XLJIg.text: We were supposed to head to Chinatown, but our taxi driver highly recommended us to come here for our long layover in Singapore. We're so happy, and found The Best Satay!!! Got some chicken and mutton, I thought were never going to finish it but glad we ordered a bunch!

VsGryxHyrpMUmZXxlQyk8g.text: Every night at 7pm, this block turns into a Satay Market. Everyone is super aggressive and pretty much selling the same thing, so pretty much you're guaranteed deliciousness with any stall you decide!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Satay - Singapore, Singapore. Shrimp and beer skewers

hJFY7D0Zppxb6C_cFqCpsw.text: First of all, DO NOT FOLLOW the annoying sales person from the "other" satay stands besides the red shirt stall 7 & 8.  There will be ppl around the area trying to pull u to their stall because the "best satay" don't need that type of pressure to have ppl eat there.  They have a simple set with shrimp, beef, chicken and mutton satay skewers.   The different sets are just varies quantities of the skewers.  Hands down best i had and highly recommend everyone who travels to singapore to try this place. Ignore the other installs tying tho sell u dishes, it's all mediocre

tzNYW9Lg-532dFi5L-JuMQ.text: With a name like that, you'd expect big things from Best Satay. Occupying 2 stalls along 'Satay Street' which opens at 7 pm beside Lau Pa Sat, Best Satay is one of a few Satay stalls competing the for satay-and-supper-loving customers who visit the place. My friends and I were no exception and after a 'light' meal, we decided to have satay to round off our dinner. It was a good decision even if I felt bloated after the meal. I loved the grilled sweet and savoury taste of the satay and the peanut sauce that accompanied it with just the right runniness. I've only tried the chicken satay because I don't like the other meats, but it was delicious and at only $0.60 per stick. In fact, the satay is often the reason we choose to eat at Lau Pa Sat.
